prompt: When someone takes too long to text back, what happens internally?

choices.text: I re-read every message for hidden signals.
I shrug and move on instantly.
I pretend not to care, then overthink at 2 a.m.
I send a meme and keep it light.

prompt: Your ideal first date energy is:

choices.text: Deep questions and a symbolic location.
Spontaneous chaos and poor logistics.
Low stakes, clear boundaries, short duration.
Simple, relaxed, and easy conversation.
Reply to everyone so nobody feels ignored.
Drop one perfect message then disappear.
Voice-note your whole emotional weather report.
Read quietly and respond when needed.

prompt: Your conflict style is best described as:

choices.text: I over-explain to keep the peace.
I call a timeout and process alone.
I spiral, then recover with humor.
I stay grounded and discuss facts.
Instant. I attach at first eye contact.
Very slow. Trust takes time.
On/off depending on cosmic signals.
Structured and intentional.

prompt: How do you react to vulnerability?

choices.text: I hold it carefully and stay present.
I dodge with jokes and logistics.
I absorb everything and worry later.
I appreciate it but keep emotional distance.
"If I stay useful, I'm lovable."
"If I leave first, I stay safe."
"If I control the ritual, I control the risk."
"If I show less, I hurt less."

prompt: What best describes your ex-file system?

choices.text: Color-coded archive with timestamps.
Deleted everything in under 5 minutes.
Messy folder, meaningful keepsakes.
Minimal trace, clean separation.

prompt: When life gets stressful, you become:

choices.text: Rigid, focused, and less emotionally available.
Intense and unpredictable.
Steady and practical.
Ritual-heavy and reflective.

prompt: Choose the ending that feels most like you:

choices.text: Unexpected, loud, and unforgettable.
Quietly complete with no residue.
Reliable finish, no drama.
Mutual closure with warm aftercare.
